page.title: 06WOODLAND NORTH OF HUNTLY
page.content: The block to the north of Huntly is appropximatly one third coverd by woodland,most of which is owned by the Forestry Commision.The main forests are the Bin Forest and the Hill of Greenfold. The most common tree on the Hill of Greenfold and the Bin section of Buchan Forest is the Picea Abies (Norway Spruce).The Forestry Commision harvest the trees when they have reached the age of maximum growth,for Norway Spruce it is on average 55-60 years.When the trees are years old they are thinned to allow the stronger trees to have a better chance to grow.The land was bought by thee Forestry Commision in 1927.
